page.title: 05WORKING THE LAND,LACEY GREEN
page.content: AGRICULTURE AND FORESTRY ARE THE MAIN LAND USES IN THIS AREA, ALTHOUGH ONLY ABOUT FIFTY PEOPLE ARE EMPLOYED IN THESE INDUSTRIES. THERE ARE{THREE {DAIRY HERDS}IN LACEY GREEN TOTALLING ABOUT{300 COWS.}THE MILK IS COLLECTED DAILY BY BULK TANKER AND IS TAKEN TO A DAIRY IN LONDON. THE REST OF FARMING IS GIVEN OVER TO ARABLE CROPS,{WHEAT, {BARLEY AND OATS WITH OIL-SEED RAPE}AS A BREAK CROP. THERE IS NO LARGE SCALE GROWING OF VEGETABLES AS THE SOIL IS TOO STONY. AT{SAUNDERTON}THERE IS A {STUD}WHERE HAFLINGER AND RACE HORSES ARE BRED. THERE ARE TWO PLANT NURSERIES, ONE NEAR POUND FARM WHICH GROWS SEEDLINGS FOR THE TRADE AND THE OTHER AT DEAN FARM WHICH IS ALSO A GARDEN CENTRE MUCH PATRONISED BY LOCAL ENTHUSIASTS. LARGE SCALE FORESTRY IS NOT PRACTISED IN THIS AREA NOWADAYS.
